newsitem.title: CHINA: Tsann Kuen to offer 40 mln new B shares.
newsitem.headline: Tsann Kuen to offer 40 mln new B shares.

text.p: Taiwan-invested appliance maker Tsann Kuen Ltd said on Tuesday it would issue 40 million new hard currency B shares.
The company would present the plan for approval at a shareholders' meeting on August 30, Tsann Kuen said in a statement in the Securities Times.
The issue would be made within one year after approval and the price would not be below the firm's per share net asset value, the statement said.
The company's net assets stood at 2.37 yuan ($0.286) per share at the end of 1996, according to the firm's 1996 annual report.
The issue price would also not be less than the average closing price of the company's existing B shares over the 15 trading days before an underwriting agreement was signed, it said.
Tsann Kuen, based in Xiamen in the southeastern province of Fujian, posted net profits of 55.53 million yuan for 1996 against 38.39 million yuan in 1995 under international accounting standards.
The company had a total of 192.4 million shares at end-1996, consisting of 52.0 million B shares and 140.4 million non-listed institutional shares.
